# templateViews

**Instance Property**

Returns the views that display this template’s predicate.

## Declaration

```swift
var templateViews: [NSView] { get }
```

## Return Value

The views for an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPredicateEditor] to display in a row that represents the predicate from [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPredicateEditorRowTemplate/setPredicate(_:)].

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPredicateEditor] treats instances of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopUpButton] specially by merging their menu items into a single popup button, and by combining menu items with matching titles. In this way, the editor builds a single tree from the separate templates.

## Primitive Methods

- **match(for:)**: Returns a positive number if the receiver can represent a given predicate, and `0` if it cannot.
- **setPredicate(_:)**: Sets the value of the views according to the given predicate.
- **displayableSubpredicates(of:)**: Returns the subpredicates that should be made sub-rows of a given predicate.
- **predicate(withSubpredicates:)**: Returns the predicate represented by the receiver’s views’ values and the given sub-predicates.
